com.uttt.common

Class ExUtil<T extends java.lang.Throwable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uttt.common.ExUtil<T>

  • public final class ExUtil<T extends java.lang.Throwable>
extends java.lang.Object
    Exception builder to support "fluent" programming and standardized error message format.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static <U extends java.lang.Throwable> ExUtil<U> create(java.lang.Class<U> exClass)

      • build

        public T build(java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Construct and return an exception of the class specified by the #create(), without a (possibly null) chained cause. Such construction is done via reflection, first looking for a constructor like Exception(String, Throwable), then for just Exception(String). The stack frame trace of the exception is then cleaned up (to remove the leading elements that refer to the reflection mechanism itself as well as the involved [ExUtil] methods).

      • build

        public T build()
        Construct and return an exception of the class specified by the #create(), without a chained cause
        See Also:
        build(Throwable)

      • append

        public ExUtil<T> append(java.lang.Integer flags,
                        java.lang.Object... messages)
        Append a sequence of items (varags) onto the pending exception's detail message. Use the flags to indicate how items should be joined, e.g. what separator (if any), with extra space before/after that separator, if the separator should always be added at the end of the sequence, etc. Also, start off with a ": " high-level separator if the accumulated message text is not empty.

      • append

        public ExUtil<T> append(ExUtil.Join join,
                        java.lang.Object... messages)

      • append

        public ExUtil<T> append(java.lang.Object... messages)

      • tackon

        public ExUtil<T> tackon(java.lang.String message)
        For fine-grained control by the caller, this method will simply append the given string onto the exception's message accumulation buffer with no separator logic at all.
